intro: Thalictrum praeflorens, commonly known as the early meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It blooms in early spring, often before many other plants have started to flower. Thalictrum praeflorens is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
